metadata.title: CVE-2015-5177 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
Double free vulnerability in the SLPDKnownDAAdd function inslpd/slpd_knownda.c in OpenSLP 1.2.1 allows remote attackers to cause adenial of service (crash) via a crafted package.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5177` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libslp1 - 1.2.1-9ubuntu0.2
slpd - 1.2.1-9ubuntu0.2
slptool - 1.2.1-9ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openslp-dfsg package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.1-9ubuntu0.2').
